intro: Cleistes risaraldensis, commonly known as the Risaralda cleistostoma, is a rare flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are often pale pink or white. Its habitat is typically moist, shaded areas in tropical montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
